intro: Viola grandiflora subsp. elongata, commonly known as the elongated pansy, is a perennial flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and vibrant, spurred petals that come in shades of purple, violet, and white. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–15 cm and thrives in cool, moist environments. It prefers partial shade and well-drained soil, making it suitable for woodland gardens. Its flowers bloom in early spring, adding a splash of color to the landscape.
